definition: to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
fan/sliding, hinged or detachable flat part of sth/classifier for doors, windows etc
to fan/to slap sb on the face

sentences.english: We found the poster on a partition door in the Villa of the East Garden.
sentences.chinese: 在東園別墅的一道隔扇門上，我們找到了那張捷報。

sentences.english: Our office is compared by a partition board.
sentences.chinese: 我們的辦公室用一個隔扇分成兩部分。

sentences.english: The increased use of wood composites in building materials results in a need for a better understanding of wood adhesion.
sentences.chinese: 臺灣傳統閩粵建築以木料作爲柱樑及隔扇的主要材料。

sentences.english: Our office is comparted by a partition board.
sentences.chinese: 我們的辦公室用一個隔扇分成兩部分。

sentences.english: There is a plywood partition between the two rooms.
sentences.chinese: 我們的辦公室用一個隔扇分成兩部分。

definition: spirit wall (screen wall used to shield an entrance in traditional Chinese architecture)
a screen wall across the gate of a house (for privacy)
interlocking wooden brackets between the top of a column and crossbeams used in traditional Chinese architecture
courtyard/atrium/opening in a roof/skylight/caisson ceiling/(TCM) acupuncture point TB10
window/the opening panel of a window
